title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \

1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083

title: Life Expectancy and GDP
text:
Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
This page analyzes the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using the Gapminder dataset.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np 

# Load the Gapminder dataset
gapminder_df = pd.read_csv("/Users/maxjiang/qtm350-quiz02/qtm350-quiz02/gapminder.csv")

# Plot the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(np.log(gapminder_df['gdp_per_capita']), gapminder_df['life_expectancy'])
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita')
plt.xlabel('GDP per Capita')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
Country Analysis
This page analyzes life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time for a selected country.

#ï½œ echo: true
#| eval: true

# Filter data for a specific country (e.g., Japan)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Load the Gapminder dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("/Users/maxjiang/qtm350-quiz02/qtm350-quiz02/gapminder.csv")

# Filter the data for Japan
country_data = gapminder[gapminder['country'] == 'Japan']

# Plot 1: Changes in Life Expectancy over time
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['life_expectancy'], label='Life Expectancy', color='b')
plt.title('Changes in Life Expectancy for Japan')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Plot 2: Changes in GDP per Capita over time
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['gdp_per_capita'], label='GDP per Capita', color='g')
plt.title('Changes in GDP per Capita for Japan')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('GDP per Capita')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Plot 3: Changes in Population over time
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['population_millions'], label='Population (millions)', color='r')
plt.title('Changes in Population for Japan')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Population (millions)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: Gapminder Data Analysis
text:
Gapminder Data Analysis
The Gapminder dataset contains information on life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for 142 countries between 1952 and 2007.

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
Life Expectancy and Population
This page analyzes the relationship between life expectancy and population using the Gapminder dataset.

# Plot the relationship between life expectancy and population
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Load the Gapminder dataset
gapminder_df = pd.read_csv("/Users/maxjiang/qtm350-quiz02/qtm350-quiz02/gapminder.csv")
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(np.log(gapminder_df['population_millions']), gapminder_df['life_expectancy'])
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs Population')
plt.xlabel('Population (millions)')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.show()
